EXTRACTED VALUE: The Bourne Conspiracy, despite its shortcomings, is an example of a very good movie-licensed game.
Lost Odyssey isn't an RPG classic. It doesn't break new ground and it has its problems, but that doesn't keep it from being great.
By far the best, most revined version of FIFA yet - its presentation and 'big game feel' are second to none. [Dec 2007, p.78]
At the very least it is worthy of a rental, if only to see how storytelling should be done in a game.
All in all, Virtua Tennis 3 is an easy to play and visually attractive title. [May 2007, p.56]
Minor gripes aside, Homecourt is a deliciously addictive baller and a commendable next-gen Street effort on EA's part.
This game is little more than a lowbrow, yet humorous, thug-life simulator.
NCAA 07 certainly has the right idea and just needs to be slightly tweaked and a bit more balanced.
New shooting controls make this version stand out. [Issue #15]
The third time is the charm for Traveller's Tales--logical puzzles and great offline co-op play make this the best Lego game yet.
Anyone with an appreciation for old school arcade games will have a blast with The Club. Just remember to leave your brain with the doorman.
A bit pricey for a game so close to "Bejeweled," but the RPG element genuinely adds to the package. [Christmas 2007, p.98]
Cloning Clyde delivers 35 levels of interesting, puzzle-based side-scrolling at a nice price.
